contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Ito district Map.png|thumb|Location of Ito District in Wakayama Prefecture]] {{Nihongo|'''Ito District'''|伊都郡|Ito-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Wakayama Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of September 1, 2008, the district has an estimated population of 28,171 and a density of 84.6 persons/km². The total area is 332.93 km². == Towns and villages == * [[Katsuragi, Wakayama|Katsuragi]] * [[Kōya, Wakayama|Kōya]] * [[Kudoyama, Wakayama|Kudoyama]] == Timeline == * On October 1, 2005 the village of [[Hanazono, Wakayama|Hanazono]] merged into the town of [[Katsuragi, Wakayama|Katsuragi]]. (4 towns) * On March 1, 2006 the town of [[Kōyaguchi, Wakayama|Kōyaguchi]] merged with the old city of [[Hashimoto, Wakayama|Hashimoto]] to form the new city of Hashimoto. (3 towns) {{Wakayama}} {{coord|34.214|N|135.557|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Wakayama Prefecture]] {{Wakayama-geo-stub}}
